title: Peptides in simple terms
summary: Peptides are short chains of amino acids that can signal processes in the body.
body: Think of them as tiny messengers. Different peptides are studied for different roles, which is why context and evidence matter.

title: Hype vs reality
summary: Some claims are early research, not proven outcomes.
body: Ask what is studied, in whom, and for how long. Promising does not mean proven.

title: Safety considerations
summary: Safety depends on sourcing, supervision, and individual risk factors.
body: Peptides are not all the same. The safest path is clinician-guided, with clear goals and monitoring.
